verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus: and finding certain disciples,
verses.ct: While Apollos was in Corinth, Paul traveled through the inland regions and arrived in Ephesus, where he found some disciples.

verses.kjv: He said unto them, Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed? And they said unto him, We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost.
verses.ct: He asked them, "Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed?" They replied, "We haven't even heard that there is a Holy Spirit."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Unto what then were ye baptized? And they said, Unto John’s baptism.
verses.ct: So he asked, "What baptism did you receive then?" They answered, "John's baptism."

verses.kjv: Then said Paul, John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance, saying unto the people, that they should believe on him which should come after him, that is, on Christ Jesus.
verses.ct: Paul explained, "John baptized people as a sign of repentance, telling them to put their faith in the one coming after him — that is, Christ Jesus."

verses.kjv: When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
verses.ct: When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

verses.kjv: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them, the Holy Ghost came on them; and they spake with tongues, and prophesied.
verses.ct: Then Paul placed his hands on them, and the Holy Spirit came upon them. They spoke in other languages and prophesied.

verses.kjv: And all the men were about twelve.
verses.ct: There were about 12 men in all.

verses.kjv: And he went into the synagogue, and spake boldly for the space of three months, disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God.
verses.ct: Paul went into the synagogue and spoke boldly for 3 months, reasoning with people and persuading them about the kingdom of God.

verses.kjv: But when divers were hardened, and believed not, but spake evil of that way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus.
verses.ct: But when some of them became stubborn and refused to believe, publicly speaking against the Way in front of the crowd, Paul left them. He took the disciples with him and held daily discussions in the lecture hall of Tyrannus.

verses.kjv: And this continued by the space of two years; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.
verses.ct: This went on for 2 years, so that everyone living in the province of Asia — both Jews and Greeks — heard the message of the Lord Jesus.

verses.kjv: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul:
verses.ct: God performed extraordinary miracles through Paul.

verses.kjv: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons, and the diseases departed from them, and the evil spirits went out of them.
verses.ct: Even cloths and work aprons that had touched his body were carried to sick people, and their diseases were cured and evil spirits left them.

verses.kjv: Then certain of the vagabond Jews, exorcists, took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the LORD Jesus, saying, We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth.
verses.ct: Some Jewish men who traveled around casting out demons tried using the name of the Lord Jesus over those with evil spirits, saying, "I command you by the Jesus that Paul preaches about."

verses.kjv: And there were seven sons of one Sceva, a Jew, and chief of the priests, which did so.
verses.ct: 7 sons of a Jewish chief priest named Sceva were doing this.

verses.kjv: And the evil spirit answered and said, Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?
verses.ct: But the evil spirit responded, "Jesus I recognize, and Paul I know about — but who are you?"

verses.kjv: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, and overcame them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.
verses.ct: Then the man with the evil spirit jumped on them and overpowered them all, beating them so badly that they ran out of the house naked and bleeding.

verses.kjv: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus; and fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.
verses.ct: News of this spread to all the Jews and Greeks living in Ephesus. Everyone was filled with awe, and the name of the Lord Jesus was held in great honor.

verses.kjv: And many that believed came, and confessed, and shewed their deeds.
verses.ct: Many who had become believers came forward, openly confessing and revealing their past practices.

verses.kjv: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together, and burned them before all men: and they counted the price of them, and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver.
verses.ct: A large number of those who had practiced sorcery gathered their scrolls together and burned them publicly. When they calculated the total value, it came to 50,000 pieces of silver.

verses.kjv: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed.
verses.ct: In this powerful way, the word of God spread and grew in influence.

verses.kjv: After these things were ended, Paul purposed in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying, After I have been there, I must also see Rome.
verses.ct: After all this had happened, Paul decided in his spirit to travel through Macedonia and Achaia and then go on to Jerusalem. He said, "After I've been there, I must visit Rome as well."

verses.kjv: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him, Timotheus and Erastus; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season.
verses.ct: He sent 2 of his assistants, Timothy and Erastus, ahead to Macedonia, while he stayed in the province of Asia for a while longer.

verses.kjv: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way.
verses.ct: Around that time, a major disturbance broke out concerning the Way.

verses.kjv: For a certain man named Demetrius, a silversmith, which made silver shrines for Diana, brought no small gain unto the craftsmen;
verses.ct: A silversmith named Demetrius, who made silver shrines of the goddess Artemis, brought in a lot of business for the craftsmen.

verses.kjv: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation, and said, Sirs, ye know that by this craft we have our wealth.
verses.ct: He gathered them together along with workers in related trades and said, "Men, you know that our prosperity comes from this business.

verses.kjv: Moreover ye see and hear, that not alone at Ephesus, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people, saying that they be no gods, which are made with hands:
verses.ct: And you can see and hear for yourselves that this Paul has convinced and led astray large numbers of people, not only in Ephesus but throughout nearly the entire province of Asia, by saying that gods made by human hands are not really gods at all.

verses.kjv: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised, and her magnificence should be destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worshippeth.
verses.ct: There's a danger not only that our trade will lose its reputation, but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be considered worthless, and she herself — worshiped throughout Asia and the whole world — will be stripped of her majesty."

verses.kjv: And when they heard these sayings, they were full of wrath, and cried out, saying, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.
verses.ct: When they heard this, they were furious and started shouting, "Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!"

verses.kjv: And the whole city was filled with confusion: and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul’s companions in travel, they rushed with one accord into the theatre.
verses.ct: The whole city was thrown into chaos. The crowd seized Gaius and Aristarchus, Paul's traveling companions from Macedonia, and rushed together into the amphitheater.

verses.kjv: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.
verses.ct: Paul wanted to go in and face the crowd, but the disciples wouldn't let him.

verses.kjv: And certain of the chief of Asia, which were his friends, sent unto him, desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre.
verses.ct: Some of the provincial officials of Asia, who were friends of his, also sent him a message urging him not to risk going into the amphitheater.

verses.kjv: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another: for the assembly was confused; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the assembly was in total confusion. Some people were shouting one thing and others something else, and most of them didn't even know why they had gathered.

verses.kjv: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude, the Jews putting him forward. And Alexander beckoned with the hand, and would have made his defence unto the people.
verses.ct: The Jews pushed Alexander to the front of the crowd. Alexander motioned with his hand, trying to make a defense to the people.

verses.kjv: But when they knew that he was a Jew, all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out, Great is Diana of the Ephesians.
verses.ct: But when they realized he was Jewish, they all shouted in unison for about 2 hours, "Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!"

verses.kjv: And when the townclerk had appeased the people, he said, Ye men of Ephesus, what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana, and of the image which fell down from Jupiter?
verses.ct: Finally the city clerk quieted the crowd and said, "People of Ephesus, everyone knows that the city of Ephesus is the guardian of the temple of the great goddess Artemis and of her image that fell from heaven.

verses.kjv: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against, ye ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rashly.
verses.ct: Since these facts are undeniable, you need to calm down and not do anything reckless.

verses.kjv: For ye have brought hither these men, which are neither robbers of churches, nor yet blasphemers of your goddess.
verses.ct: You've brought these men here, but they haven't robbed any temples or insulted our goddess.

verses.kjv: Wherefore if Demetrius, and the craftsmen which are with him, have a matter against any man, the law is open, and there are deputies: let them implead one another.
verses.ct: So if Demetrius and his fellow craftsmen have a legal complaint against anyone, the courts are open and there are judges available. They can press charges there.

verses.kjv: But if ye enquire any thing concerning other matters, it shall be determined in a lawful assembly.
verses.ct: If there's anything else you want to address, it must be settled in a proper legal assembly.

verses.kjv: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day’s uproar, there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse.
verses.ct: As it stands, we're at risk of being charged with rioting over today's events, since there's no legitimate reason we can give for this commotion."

verses.kjv: And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.
verses.ct: After saying this, he dismissed the crowd.
